showerReviews.reviewText: ‚Ä¶ is mesmerising and beautiful. I can spend the whole day and still want to stay more. Restroom and shower outside to clean after playing at the beach. Nice sidewalk to go around and kids can play around. Definitely recommend to try this ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ ramp that stays busy. Swimming area. Horse shoe pier with swings and picnic tables. Bathrooms near the lake with shower outside and a few inside. Basketball court and sand volleyball! Several pavillions aswell. We will definitely be back!

It's a great park! Will definitely come back during the summer.  Our camper does not have a shower so we have to use the bathhouse. It was cold walking back to the camper after my shower because it was 26 degrees outside LOL Bathhouse is ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ swings, boat access, and of course a little beach with swim access to the lake. The bathroom has a shower outside of it to wash off if needed. Lots of pavilions to hold gatherings and grills. A huge lawn area for picnics or playing ball ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ but nice place to enjoy with family and friends. It has kids play area and swings and slides...with boat trailers and it also had one shower area to clean your self after having fun in water. Some bbq shelters as well. Lot of people and ‚Ä¶

My niece had her baby shower in the building you can reserve and it was beautiful.  The wooden doors as I call them can open up to the view of the water.. It's not fully enclosed as far as the roof goes but it was a beautiful day and a ‚Ä¶

I would give them 5 stars,  except the bathroom needs a major update.  The shower flow was terrible and the water did not come out hot.  If you're in a trailer that doesn't require you using a bathhouse,  this is a beautiful spot.  But if ‚Ä¶
The only bad thing about the park it charges $40-$80 for a pass and had no shower to clean off in the restroom by the water for what they charge there should be showers to use coming out of the water
Nice camping area. RV sites with hook ups. Clean bath/shower area. Wonderful waterfront views. Large picnic area

showerReviews.reviewText: I only stayed for one night, but the site was completely level. The laundry room was huge and had several washer and dryers. Plenty enough for several people. There was a Publix within walking distance and a food truck and bar across the street. Perfect for a quick stop over.

We enjoyed our 5-day stay at this camp.  Certainly not fancy, but the staff are fantastic and the place is kept very clean - spacious, pristine laundry room and bathroom/showers. The roads could certainly use some work, but nothing ‚Ä¶

Smh when reading some of the previous negative reviews.   This place is an excellent stop as part of your journey.  Friendly, polite staff.  Clean property and facilities. Super convenient to the grocery store, restaurants and even a cool ‚Ä¶

Camp hosts were so wonderful. My mom and I camped here for a Mothers Day weekend. Having our firewood and fire pit delivered was so nice. Super clean bath houses!  I was sick after day 2 and we had to leave. The owner called to check on us, we felt so cared for!  Camp here if you are visiting Charlotte or nearby  places.
